brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether the postoperative insulin resistance and
      cytokine release would be attenuated in laparoscopic compared with open liver resection.

clinical_study.brief_title: Surgical Stress After Laparoscopic Compared to Open Liver Resection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ASA 1-2

          -  left hemihepatectomy(liver resection)

          -  left lateral sectionectomy(liver resection)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with diabetes mellitus

          -  drug abuse

          -  BMI >24 or <18

facility.name: Sir Run Run Shaw Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.official_title: Surgical Stress Induced Insulin Resistance and Cytokine Response After Laparoscopic Compared to Open Liver Resection

primary_outcome.description:
At baseline prior to surgery, and 3hr, 12hr, 24hr, 72hrs after operation, blood glucose and insulin was measured.
Insulin resistance is assessed by the HOMAIR(homeostatic model assessment of insulin resistance) score which is calculated through the  mathematic formula: HOMAIR= FI ×FG/22.5, where FI= fasting serum insulin(μU/mL), FG= fasting plasma glucose (mmol/L), and 22.5 is a constant.
primary_outcome.measure: postoperative insulin resistance calculated by serum insulin and blood glucose

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: At baseline before operation and 0, 3hr, 12hr, 24hr, D3, D5 after operation, duplicated samples were drawn to analyze serum IL-1β, IFN-γ, IL-4 and IL-10.
secondary_outcome.measure: cytokine changement including IL-1β, IFN-γ, IL-4 and IL-10 before and after operation

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
